thread.title: Orange weather warning for five counties as Storm Amy set to hit
thread.title_full: Orange weather warning for five counties as Storm Amy set to hit

author: @ExtraIRL
title: Orange weather warning for five counties as Storm Amy set to hit
text:
Met Ã‰ireann have issued a Status Orange wind warning for five Irish counties on Friday as the country braces itself for difficult travelling conditions and potential power cuts.
A Status Yellow wind warning comes into effect for all of Ireland from 12pm on Friday, with the warning valid until midnight.
The forecaster says Storm Amy will bring â€˜strong to near gale force and gusty southwesterly winds.â€™
Potential impacts of the warning include difficult travelling conditions, debris and loose objects displaced and some fallen trees.
From 2pm on Friday, a Status Orange wind warning will come into effect for Donegal, Galway, Leitrim, Mayo and Sligo. The warning remains in effect until 10pm.
Met Ã‰ireann add that further impacts for those counties include damage to power lines and potential power outages and possible wave overtopping.

On Thursday (today) a number of warnings are in place including a Status Orange rain warning in Kerry and Status Yellow thunderstorm warning for Connacht.
Road users are urged to be cautious due to potential flooding and difficult travelling conditions in The Kingdom.
The warning remains in effect until 8pm, while the warning in Connacht stays in place until 2pm.
Thursday morning update with latest on heavy rain today and storm Amy tomorrow as weather warnings are upgraded for some areas. Watch video for full update.
â€” Carlow Weather (@CarlowWeather)[pic.twitter.com/7CCIHSmeSF][October 2, 2025]
Heavy rain fall as a result of Storm Amy has resulted in a status yellow rain warning in place in Cavan, Donegal, Munster, Connacht and Longford on Thursday.
The warning came into effect at 6am on Thursday morning and is not expected to cease until 8pm on Thursday.
Weather expert Alan Oâ€™Reilly of Carlow Weather has confirmed â€˜heavy rainâ€™ in the west on Thursday morning as well as some thunder and lighting in parts of Galway and Clare.
Speaking about Fridayâ€™s warnings, Alan said: â€˜Those winds are really going to pack a punch on Friday as Storm Amy moves in, especially in the west and northwest. Remember, very wet weather today.â€™
He added: â€˜It does look like Amyâ€™s going to come a little bit closer and itâ€™s gonna be very windy tomorrow but also very wet.
â€˜Itâ€™s nothing like Storm Eowyn. Itâ€™s not going to be at the level of Eowyn.â€™
